pr_title: WFLY-14061 Replace Java EE references in java doc with corresponding …

timeline.bodyText:
"since ... 3.2" is not correct.
I think in general if we encountered problems related to the use of "since XXX" we should drop that bit of text, unless it adds a lot of benefit. We put out new releases of docs with each new WF release, so this kind of "since XXX" info generally isn't that useful. The reader isn't having to guess whether the text is relevant to their release.
The "see 18.2.3" part is problematic too. Here's the Jakarta Enterprise Beans 3.2 spec:
https://jakarta.ee/specifications/enterprise-beans/3.2/enterprise-beans-spec-3.2.html
There is no 18.2.3. There's not much at all.
Basically Jakarta EE 8 relies on the Java EE 8 spec docs for all the details. There's no real way to be correct about this kind of reference without referring to EJB.
I don't see a lot of value in the whole (since EJB3.1 see 18.2.3).
Also, since this line is being edited:
s/it will be not longer/it will no longer be/g
timeline.author: bstansberry
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -186,7 +186,7 @@ The timer is will be started once at the specified time.
 
 In case of a server restart the timeout method of a persistent timer
 will only be called directly if the specified time is elapsed. +
-If the timer is not persistent (since EJB3.1 see 18.2.3) it will be not
+If the timer is not persistent (since Jakarta Enterprise Beans 3.2 see 18.2.3) it will be not

replies.bodyText:
The Jakarta Enterprise Beans 3.2 spec contents or lack of, is sadly caused by undetected errors translating the asciidoc => html/pdf files.
IMO +1 for removing the whole (since Jakarta Enterprise Beans 3.2 see 18.2.3).
replies.author: scottmarlow

replies.bodyText: I'm asking if it is possible to fix the broken EE 8 SPEC doc pages.
replies.author: scottmarlow

replies.bodyText:
I'm asking if it is possible to fix the broken EE 8 SPEC doc pages.

https://www.eclipse.org/lists/jakartaee-platform-dev/msg02286.html mentions that a full SPEC ballot process is needed to update the EE 8 SPEC doc.
https://www.eclipse.org/mhonarc/lists/jakartaee-platform-dev/msg02287.html mentions that the only published spec doc for EE 8 was the Platform SPEC doc.
My question now is how important (to WildFly) is it that there be Jakarta EE 8 SPEC API documentation?
replies.author: scottmarlow

timeline.bodyText:
Same discussion as above, and
s/it will be not/it will no/g
timeline.author: bstansberry
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -201,7 +201,7 @@ execution.
 In case of server downtime for a persistent timer, the timeout method
 will be called only once if one, or more than one, interval is
 elapsed. +
-If the timer is not persistent (since EJB3.1 see 18.2.3) it will not
+If the timer is not persistent (since Jakarta Enterprise Beans 3.2 see 18.2.3) it will not

timeline.author: bstansberry

replies.bodyText: It looks like the invalid asciidoc issues were fixed for EE 9 via https://jakarta.ee/specifications/enterprise-ws/2.0/enterprise-ws-spec-2.0.html.
replies.author: scottmarlow

timeline.message: WFLY-14061 Replace Java EE references in java doc with corresponding Jakarta EE ones

timeline.author: bstansberry
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -186,8 +186,8 @@ The timer is will be started once at the specified time.
 
 In case of a server restart the timeout method of a persistent timer
 will only be called directly if the specified time is elapsed. +
-If the timer is not persistent (since EJB3.1 see 18.2.3) it will be not
-longer available if JBoss is restarted or the application is redeployed.
+If the timer is not persistent, It will no longer be available

timeline.author: bstansberry
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -201,9 +201,8 @@ execution.
 In case of server downtime for a persistent timer, the timeout method
 will be called only once if one, or more than one, interval is
 elapsed. +
-If the timer is not persistent (since EJB3.1 see 18.2.3) it will not
-longer be active after the server is restarted or the application is
-redeployed.
+If the timer is not persistent, It will no longer be active

timeline.message: WFLY-14061 Replace Java EE references in java doc with corresponding Jakarta EE ones
WFLY-14061 Replace Java EE references in java doc with corresponding Jakarta EE ones
